algorithm_technique: Dynamic programming with hashmap for O(1) lookups
problem_summary_simple: Find the longest arithmetic subsequence with a specific difference between elements.
problem_summary_technical: Uses a hashmap to store the length of the longest arithmetic subsequence ending at a particular number, enabling O(1) lookups for previous elements.
key_insights: The core idea is to track the length of the longest arithmetic subsequence ending at each number.
A hashmap (dictionary) is crucial for efficient lookups of `arr[i] - difference`.
The problem can be viewed as finding the longest path in a directed acyclic graph where nodes are numbers and edges exist if the difference matches.
